Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma gets the batter Teja Nidamanuru to hit to long on and India win by 160 runs
Ravindra Jadeja's introduction brought Rohit Sharma success
Pre-Game Insights: India chose to bat and said they go in unchanged
Netherlands chose to field and said they too are fielding the same XI as the one that played against England
Post-Match Reflections: A convincing India victory that sends them 9-0 in the league stage
For Netherlands, the end of a chapter that was very promising
Miscellaneous Highlights: A convincing India victory that sends them 9-0 in the league stage
Others: India finished on 410/4, their highest second-highest World Cup score and their second 400+ total in WCs
India's batters are in pristine form
Bengaluru is always a tough place for bowlers and today they were good (if not great)
India will switch back on for the seriousness of the New Zealand fixture after a few light moments today
The team will be mighty pleased with the batting grit they showed against an Indian attack that looks oh-so-menacing
